5. OTA API Integration¶

The over-the-air interface uses messages as the basis for communication. Messages are retrieved and submitted using Inmarsat’s IDP Messaging API.

The key Messaging API operations used are:

  • get_return_messages is used for retrieving periodic reports, alerts and parameter/data read responses. See From-Mobile Messages.
  • submit_messages is used for configuration, and on-demand reading/writing of parameters or raw Modbus data. See To-Mobile Messages.

5.1. Message Structure¶

Each message is structured as a set of data fields that encapsulate different types of data.

Return Messages (aka Mobile-Originated, From-Mobile) are structured as follows:

Messages[{
   ID,
   MessageUTC,
   ReceiveUTC,
   SIN,
   MobileID,
   OTAMessageSize,
   RawPayload,
   RegionName,
   Payload{
      Name,
      SIN,
      MIN,
      Fields[
         {
         Name,
         Type,
         <Value>,
         <Elements>[
            {
            Index,
            Fields[
               {
               Name,
               Type,
               Value
               }]
            }]
         }
      ]
   }
}]

Forward Messages (aka Mobile-Terminated, To-Mobile) are structured as follows:

Messages[{
   DestinationID,
   <UserMessageID>,
   <RawPayload>,
   <Payload>[
      <Name>,
      <isForward>,
      SIN,
      MIN,
      <Fields>[
         {
         Name,
         <Type>,
         <Value>,
         <Elements>[
            {
            Index,
            Fields[
               {
               Name,
               <Type>,
               Value
               }]
            }]
         }
      ]
   ]
}]

5.1.1. Example¶

An report with a single parameter Payload within a ReturnMessage for periodicReport (MIN 100) is:

Payload[
  Name: "periodicReport",
  SIN: 200,
  MIN: 100,
  Fields: [
        {
          Name: "reportId",
          Type: "unsignedint",
          Value: 1
        },
        {
          Name: "parameters",
          Type: "array",
          Elements: [
                {
                  Index: 0,
                  Fields: [
                        {
                          Name: "paramId",
                          Type: "unsignedint",
                          Value: 1
                        },
                        {
                          Name: "value",
                          Type: "unsignedint",
                          Value: 300
                        }
                  ]
                }
          ]
        }
  ]
]

5.2. Message Definitions¶

How to Read the Tables

The tables used in this section follow the convention of the ORBCOMM Lua Terminal API documentation (T202, T405).

  • Field Name is a description for the Field.Name (case sensitive)

  • Type is the (data) type passed in the REST API

    • boolean for values held in Coils or Digital Inputs
    • unsignedint is used for 16-bit unsigned integers
    • signedint is used for both 16-bit and 32-bit signed integers
    • string is used to transport 32-bit floating point numbers and ASCII data
    • data is used to transport raw byte arrays
    • array is used to encapsulate parameters
    • enum is used by some configuration messages to enumerate static labels with integer values

  • Optional means that the field may or may not be included in a submission or response

  • Fixed means that the length of the field is fixed (vs. variable)

  • Size is the length of the field, depending on the Type encoding it represents:

    • Bits when the Type is unsignedint, signedint, boolean, or enum
    • Bytes when the Type is string (characters) or data
    • Elements (maximum) when the Type is array (note that array OTA size is complex to calculate)

Note

The Lua Service Framework used on IDP-series terminals does not support unsigned 32-bit integers, so the Modbus service only supports 16-bit unsigned. You could work around this by defining a 32-bit unsignedint as raw in config.dat.

Note

The Lua Service Framework does not support floating point data types natively as message fields. Modbus service converts IEEE floating point to a string value of the decimal number (e.g. “123.456” instead of 0x42f6e979 or [66 246 233 121]).

5.2.1. To-Mobile Messages¶

To-Mobile Messages¶
MIN Name Description
10 setModbusConfig Configure ports, devices, parameters and properties
11 getModbusConfig Get configuration of ports, devices, parameters and properties
12 delModbusConfig Delete configuration(s)
13 setReportConfig Configure periodic reports
14 getReportConfig Get configuration of periodic reports
15 delReportConfig Delete periodic reports
16 setAlertConfig Configure alerts
17 getAlertConfig Get configuration of alerts
18 delAlertConfig Delete configuration of alerts
19 readParam Read parameters data values immediately.
20 writeParam Write parameters data values immediately.
21 readData Read a Modbus register directly.
22 writeData Write a Modbus register directly.
23 setRefPosition Sets the current location as the geolocation reference, and acknowledges a positionChangeAlert

5.2.1.1. setModbusConfig (MIN 10)¶

Configures Modbus ports, devices, parameters (and optionally properties).

setModbusConfig¶
Field Name Type Optional Fixed Size Comments
ports array Y N 3 A serial port used to connect to one or more Modbus devices.
  • port
 enum N N/A 2
Name of the port
rs232
rs485
rs232aux
  • baudRate
 enum N N/A 3
Speed of serial communications.
1200, 2400, 4800, 9600, 19200, 38400, 57600, 115200
  • parity
 enum N N/A 2
none
even
odd
  • mode
 enum N N/A 1 rtu or ascii
devices array Y N 100 Configuration of Modbus slave devices.
  • deviceId
 unsignedint N N/A 8 Unique identifier of the device in the Modbus service.
  • networkId
 unsignedint N N/A 8 Modbus Slave address on the physical network.
  • port
 enum N N/A 2 Serial port on which the device is attached.
  • pollInterval
 unsignedint N N/A 17 The interval (seconds) at which the device registers are polled.
  • byteOrder
 enum Y N/A 1 msb or lsb
  • wordOrder
 enum Y N/A 1 msw or lsw
  • serialRxTimeout
 unsignedint Y N/A 15 Read timeout (milliseconds) waiting on next byte to be received.
  • serialTxTimeout
 unsignedint Y N/A 15 Read timeout (milliseconds) waiting on last transmitted byte to be confirmed.
  • plcBaseAddress
 enum Y N/A 1 1 = Use PLC addressing (non zero-based)
  • retries
 unsignedint Y N/A 4 The number of serial retries to attempt before raising a communication error.
parameters array Y N 300 Configuration of parameters used by the service.
  • paramId
 unsignedint N N/A 10 Unique identifier of the parameter used for reporting and analytics.
  • deviceId
 unsignedint N N/A 8 Unique identifier of the device in the Modbus service.
  • registerType
 enum N N/A 2
coil - discrete output coil
input - discrete digital input
analog - (analog) input register
holding - holding register
  • encoding
 enum N N/A 4 boolean, int8, uint8, int16, uint16, int32, float32, string, base64string, raw
  • address
 unsignedint N N/A 31 Starting Modbus register address of the data
  • length
 unsignedint Y N/A 12 Number of registers used to contain the data (including the starting address)
  • mult
 unsignedint Y N/A 7 A multiplier applied to the data value prior to reporting or analytics.
properties array Y N/A 245 Mapping of parameters to properties.
  • paramId
 unsignedint N N/A 10 Unique identifier of the parameter used for reporting and analytics.
  • pin
 unsignedint N N/A 8 The property identification number (within Modbus service) to hold the parameter value.

5.2.1.2. getModbusConfig (MIN 11)¶

Retrieves select Modbus configuration(s).

getModbusConfig¶
Field Name Type Optional Fixed Size Comments
port enum Y Y 3
If included, specifies the port configuration being queried. If not included, all ports configurations will be returned.
rs232
rs485
rs232aux
deviceId unsignedint Y Y 8 If included, specifies the device configuration being queried. If not included, all device configurations will be returned.
paramId unsignedint Y Y 10 If included, specifies the parameter configuration being queried. If not included, all parameters configurations will be returned.
properties boolean Y Y 1 If included, properties configured will be returned.

5.2.1.3. delModbusConfig (MIN 12)¶

Deletes select Modbus configuration(s).

delModbusConfig¶
Field Name Type Optional Fixed Size Comments
ports array Y N 3 If included, configuration for the specified ports will be deleted. If not included, no ports will be deleted.
  • port
 enum N Y 2
Name of the port configuration to delete.
rs232
rs485
rs232aux
devices array Y N 100 If included, configuration for the specified devices will be deleted. If not included, no devices will be deleted.
  • deviceId
 unsignedint N Y 8 Unique identifier of the device to delete.
parameters array Y N 300 If included, configuration for the specified parameters will be deleted. If not included, no parameters will be deleted.
  • paramId
 unsignedint N N/A 10 Unique identifier of the parameter to delete.
properties array Y N 245 If included, configuration for the specified properties will be deleted. If not included, no properties will be deleted.
  • property
 unsignedint N N/A 10 The property identification number (within Modbus service) to hold the parameter value.

5.2.1.4. setReportConfig (MIN 13)¶

Configures periodic reports.

setReportConfig¶
Field Name Type Optional Fixed Size Comments
reports array N N 100 The list of periodic reports to configure.
  • reportId
 unsignedint N Y 31 Unique identifier of the report associated with particular parameter values.
  • paramIds
 string N N 255 Comma-separated list of parameter ids to be included in the report.
  • interval
 unsignedint N Y 20 The periodic report interval, in seconds. The first report will be sent as soon as the new configuration is applied.
  • timeOfDay
 unsignedint Y Y 18 Optional time of day, in seconds (0..86400) to create a snapshot that will be reported within the timeOfDayWindow.
  • timeOfDayWindow
 unsignedint Y Y 13 Must be included if using timeOfDay. Window, in seconds, within which the report will be sent offset relative to the timeOfDay snapshot.
  • msgBitMap
 string Y Y 2 ASCII string of metadata fields to include, overriding defaultMsgBitmap value. See Optional Metadata Fields Configuration (MsgBitmap, defaultMsgBitmap).

5.2.1.5. getReportConfig (MIN 14)¶

Retrieves select Report configuration(s).

getReportConfig¶
Field Name Type Optional Fixed Size Comments
reportId unsignedint Y Y 31 If included, specifies the report configuration being queried. If not included, all reports configurations will be returned.

5.2.1.6. delReportConfig (MIN 15)¶

Deletes select Report configuration(s).

delReportConfig¶
Field Name Type Optional Fixed Size Comments
reportId unsignedint Y Y 31

If included, specifies the report configuration being deleted.

Warning

If not included, all reports configurations will be deleted.

5.2.1.7. setAlertConfig (MIN 16)¶

Configures alerts.

setAlertConfig¶
Field Name Type Optional Fixed Size Comments
alerts array N N 100 The list of alerts to configure.
  • alertId
 unsignedint N Y 31 Unique identifier of the alert associated with a particular parameter trigger.
  • paramId
 unsignedint N Y 10 The ID of the trigger parameter on which the analytics is run.
  • paramIds
 string Y N 255 Comma-separated list of parameter values to be included in the alert, in addition to the trigger parameter.
  • minON
 int Y Y 32 The lower threshold against which the parameter is tested. If the value drops below this, an alertON is sent. The parameter stays in the alert state until the value rises above minOFF.
  • minOFF
 int Y Y 32

The normal low threshold against which the parameter is tested. If the parameter is in the alert state and rises above this value, the alert state is off and an alertOFF is sent.

If not specified, minON will be used as the return to normal trigger.
  • maxON
 int Y Y 32 The upper threshold against which the parameter is tested. If the value rises above this, an alertON is sent. The parameter stays in the alert state until the value drops below maxOFF.
  • maxOFF
 int Y Y 32

The normal high threshold against which the parameter is tested. If the parameter is in the alert state and drops below this value, the alert state is off and an alertOFF is sent.

If not specified, maxON will be used as the return to normal trigger.
  • change
 unsignedint Y Y 31 The absolute value difference from the last reported value, which will trigger a alertChange to be sent.
  • msgBitMap
 string Y Y 2 ASCII string of metadata fields to include, overriding defaultMsgBitmap value. See Optional Metadata Fields Configuration (MsgBitmap, defaultMsgBitmap).

5.2.1.8. getAlertConfig (MIN 17)¶

Retrieves select Alert configuration(s).

getAlertConfig¶
Field Name Type Optional Fixed Size Comments
alertId unsignedint Y Y 31 If included, specifies the alert configuration being queried. If not included, all alerts configurations will be returned.

5.2.1.9. delAlertConfig (MIN 18)¶

Deletes select Alert configuration(s).

delAlertConfig¶
Field Name Type Optional Fixed Size Comments
alertId unsignedint Y Y 31

If included, specifies the alert configuration being deleted.

Warning

If not included, all alerts configurations will be deleted.

5.2.1.10. readParam (MIN 19)¶

Reads select parameter values immediately.

readParam¶
Field Name Type Optional Fixed Size Comments
parameters array N N 100 The list of parameter values being queried.
  • paramId
 unsignedint N Y 10 Unique identifier of the parameter to query.

5.2.1.11. writeParam (MIN 20)¶

Writes select parameter values immediately. (Must be coil or holding types)

writeParam¶
Field Name Type Optional Fixed Size Comments
parameters array N N 100 The list of parameter values being written.
  • paramId
 unsignedint N Y 10 Unique identifier of the parameter to write.
  • value
 string N N 255 The value, in string format, to write to the parameter.

5.2.1.12. readData (MIN 21)¶

Reads select blocks of Modbus addresses directly.

readData¶
Field Name Type Optional Fixed Size Comments
addresses array N N 100 The list of Modbus register addresses to be read.
  • deviceId
 unsignedint N Y 8 Unique identifier of the device in the configuration.
  • registerType
 enum N Y 2
The register type:
coil
input
inputRegister
holdingRegister
  • address
 unsignedint N Y 31 The starting address to read. (May be offset if device is configured with plcBaseAddress)
  • encoding
 enum N Y 4
Data conversion to apply to the requested value when responding.
boolean
int8
uInt8
int16
uInt16
int32
float32
string
base64string
raw
  • length
 unsignedint Y Y 12 The number of registers to read. This is implied for all encoding types except string, base64string and raw
  • byteOrder
 enum Y Y 1
Byte order for interpreting data response.
msb (default) most significant byte
lsb least significant byte
  • wordOrder
 enum Y Y 1
Word order (16-bit blocks) for interpreting data response.
msw (default) most significant word
lsw least significant word

5.2.1.13. writeData (MIN 22)¶

Writes select blocks of Modbus addresses directly. (Must be Output Coils or Holding Registers)

writeData¶
Field Name Type Optional Fixed Size Comments
addresses array N N 100 The list of Modbus register addresses to be read.
  • deviceId
 unsignedint N Y 8 Unique identifier of the device in the configuration.
  • registerType
 enum N Y 2
The register type:
coil
input
inputRegister
holdingRegister
  • address
 unsignedint N Y 31 The starting address to write. (May be offset if device is configured with plcBaseAddress)
  • encoding
 enum N Y 4
Data conversion to apply to the submitted (string) value when writing to the register.
boolean
int8
uInt8
int16
uInt16
int32
float32
string
base64string
raw
  • value
 string N N 255

The value to write, presented as an ASCII string.

  • For sending raw data, the string must be represented as space separated hex values e.g. “0A 1B 2C”
  • For sending Boolean data, the string must be represented as a number e.g. “1” for true
  • byteOrder
 enum Y Y 1
Byte order for interpreting data response.
msb (default) most significant byte
lsb least significant byte
  • wordOrder
 enum Y Y 1
Word order (16-bit blocks) for interpreting data response.
msw (default) most significant word
lsw least significant word

5.2.1.14. setRefPosition (MIN 23)¶

Acknowledges the receipt of a positionChangeAlert (MIN 104) and sets the current location as the new movement reference.

This message contains no Fields, it is just submitted with SIN and MIN.

5.2.2. From-Mobile Messages¶

From-Mobile Messages¶
MIN Name Description
10 modbusConfig Response to set/get/del ModbusConfig
11 reportConfig Response to set/get/del ReportConfig
12 alertConfig Response to set/get/del AlertConfig
13 readParamResults Response to readParam
14 writeParamResults Response to writeParam
15 readDataResults Response to readData
16 writeDataResults Response to writeData
100 periodicReport Periodic report generated at time interval or time of day.
101 paramAlertON Immediate alert generated by high/low threshold trigger.
102 paramAlertOFF Immediate alert generated by return to normal from outside threshold.
103 paramAlertChange Immediate alert generated by change threshold trigger.
104 positionChangeAlert Immediate alert based on movement detection/geolocation.
200 error Error alert due to Modbus/serial or configuration problem.

5.2.2.1. modbusConfig (MIN 10)¶

Response to setModbusConfig (MIN 10) or getModbusConfig (MIN 11) or delModbusConfig (MIN 12).

modbusConfig¶
Field Name Type Optional Fixed Size Comments
ports array Y Y 3 Included only if the set/get operation specified ports.
  • port
 enum N N/A 2
Name of the port
rs232
rs485
rs232aux
  • baudRate
 enum N N/A 3
Speed of serial communications.
1200, 2400, 4800, 9600, 19200, 38400, 57600, 115200
  • parity
 enum N N/A 2
none
even
odd
  • mode
 enum N N/A 1 rtu or ascii
devices array Y N 100 Included only if the set/get operation specified devices.
  • deviceId
 unsignedint N N/A 8 Unique identifier of the device in the Modbus service.
  • networkId
 unsignedint N N/A 8 Modbus Slave address on the physical network.
  • port
 enum N N/A 2 Serial port on which the device is attached.
  • pollInterval
 unsignedint N N/A 17 The interval (seconds) at which the device registers are polled.
  • byteOrder
 enum N N/A 1 msb or lsb
  • wordOrder
 enum N N/A 1 msw or lsw
  • serialRxTimeout
 unsignedint N N/A 15 Read timeout (milliseconds) waiting on next byte to be received.
  • serialTxTimeout
 unsignedint N N/A 15 Read timeout (milliseconds) waiting on last transmitted byte to be confirmed.
  • plcBaseAddress
 enum N N/A 1 1 = Use PLC addressing (non zero-based)
  • retries
 unsignedint N N/A 4 The number of serial retries to attempt before raising a communication error.
parameters array Y N 300 Included only if the set/get operation specified parameters.
  • paramId
 unsignedint N N/A 10 Unique identifier of the parameter used for reporting and analytics.
  • deviceId
 unsignedint N N/A 8 Unique identifier of the device in the Modbus service.
  • registerType
 enum N N/A 2
coil - discrete output coil
input - discrete digital input
analog - (analog) input register
holding - holding register
  • encoding
 enum N N/A 4 boolean, int8, uint8, int16, uint16, int32, float32, string, base64string, raw
  • address
 unsignedint N N/A 31 Starting Modbus register address of the data
  • length
 unsignedint N N/A 12 Number of registers used to contain the data (including the starting address)
  • mult
 unsignedint N N/A 7 A multiplier applied to the data value prior to reporting or analytics.
properties array Y N/A 245 Included only if the set/get operation specified properties.
  • paramId
 unsignedint N N/A 10 Unique identifier of the parameter used for reporting and analytics.
  • pin
 unsignedint N N/A 8 The property identification number (within Modbus service) to hold the parameter value.

5.2.2.2. reportConfig (MIN 11)¶

Response to setReportConfig (MIN 13) or getReportConfig (MIN 14) or delReportConfig (MIN 15).

reportConfig¶
Field Name Type Optional Fixed Size Comments
reports array N N 100 The list of periodic reports configured (set) or requested (get).
  • reportId
 unsignedint N Y 31 Unique identifier of the report associated with particular parameter values.
  • paramIds
 string N N 255 Comma-separated list of parameter ids to be included in the report.
  • interval
 unsignedint N Y 20 The periodic report interval, in seconds.
  • timeOfDay
 unsignedint Y Y 18 Optional time of day, in seconds (0..86400) to create a snapshot that will be reported within the timeOfDayWindow.
  • timeOfDayWindow
 unsignedint Y Y 13 Included if using timeOfDay. Window, in seconds, within which the report will be sent offset relative to the timeOfDay snapshot.
  • msgBitMap
 string Y Y 2 ASCII string of metadata fields to include, overriding defaultMsgBitmap value. See Optional Metadata Fields Configuration (MsgBitmap, defaultMsgBitmap).

5.2.2.3. alertConfig (MIN 12)¶

Response to setAlertConfig (MIN 16) or getAlertConfig (MIN 17) or delAlertConfig (MIN 18).

alertConfig¶
Field Name Type Optional Fixed Size Comments
alerts array N N 100 The list of alerts configured (set) or requested (get).
  • alertId
 unsignedint N Y 31 Unique identifier of the alert associated with a particular parameter trigger.
  • paramId
 unsignedint N Y 10 The ID of the trigger parameter on which the analytics is run.
  • paramIds
 string Y N 255 Comma-separated list of parameter values to be included in the alert, in addition to the trigger parameter.
  • minON
 int Y Y 32 The lower threshold against which the parameter is tested. If the value drops below this, an alertON is sent. The parameter stays in the alert state until the value rises above minOFF.
  • minOFF
 int Y Y 32

The normal low threshold against which the parameter is tested. If the parameter is in the alert state and rises above this value, the alert state is off and an alertOFF is sent.

If not specified, minON will be used as the return to normal trigger.
  • maxON
 int Y Y 32 The upper threshold against which the parameter is tested. If the value rises above this, an alertON is sent. The parameter stays in the alert state until the value drops below maxOFF.
  • maxOFF
 int Y Y 32

The normal high threshold against which the parameter is tested. If the parameter is in the alert state and drops below this value, the alert state is off and an alertOFF is sent.

If not specified, maxON will be used as the return to normal trigger.
  • change
 unsignedint Y Y 31 The absolute value difference from the last reported value, which will trigger a alertChange to be sent.
  • msgBitMap
 string Y Y 2 ASCII string of metadata fields to include, overriding defaultMsgBitmap value. See Optional Metadata Fields Configuration (MsgBitmap, defaultMsgBitmap).

5.2.2.4. readParamResults (MIN 13)¶

Response to readParam (MIN 19).

readParamResults¶
Field Name Type Optional Fixed Size Comments
parameters array N N 100 The list of parameter values being queried.
  • paramId
 unsignedint N Y 10 Unique identifier of the parameter to query.
  • value

dynamic

  • unsignedint
  • signedint
  • string
  • data
 N N/A N/A

Value with data type corresponding to the parameter encoding:

  • uint8, uint16 use unsignedInt
  • int8, int16, int32 use signedInt
  • float32, string, base64string use string
  • raw uses data
  • paramTimestamp
 unsignedint Y N/A 31

Parameter timestamp in seconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z.

Only present if paramTimestamp is configured in metadata options.
  • errText
 string Y N 100 Verbose error text if a read error occurred.
timestamp unsignedint Y Y 31

Response timestamp, seconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z.

Only present if configured in metadata options.

5.2.2.5. writeParamResults (MIN 14)¶

Response to writeParam (MIN 20).

writeParamResults¶
Field Name Type Optional Fixed Size Comments
parameters array N N 100 The list of parameter values being queried.
  • paramId
 unsignedint N Y 10 Unique identifier of the parameter to query.
  • paramTimestamp
 unsignedint Y N/A 31

Parameter timestamp in seconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z.

Only present if paramTimestamp is configured in metadata options.
  • errText
 string Y N 100 Verbose error text if a read error occurred.
timestamp unsignedint Y Y 31

Response timestamp, seconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z.

Only present if configured in metadata options.

5.2.2.8. periodicReport (MIN 100)¶

Sent automatically at the prescribed time interval or offset from Time of Day.

periodicReport¶
Field Name Type Optional Fixed Size Comments
reportId unsignedint N Y 8 Unique identifer of the report.
timestamp unsignedint Y Y 31

Report timestamp, seconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z.

Only present if configured in metadata options.
parameters array N N 100 A set of parameter values defined by the report configuration.
  • paramId
 unsignedint N N/A 8 The paramId being reported.
  • value

dynamic

  • unsignedint
  • signedint
  • string
  • data
 N N/A N/A

Value with data type corresponding to the parameter encoding:

  • uint8, uint16 use unsignedInt
  • int8, int16, int32 use signedInt
  • float32, string, base64string use string
  • raw uses data
  • paramTimestamp
 unsignedint Y N/A 31

Parameter timestamp in seconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z.

Only present if paramTimestamp is configured in metadata options.
latitude signedint Y Y 24

Latitude in milliminutes, if present in metadata options.

Divide by 60000 to get decimal degrees (round to 6 decimal places precision).
longitude signedint Y Y 25

Longitude in milliminutes, if present in metadata options.

Divide by 60000 to get decimal degrees (round to 6 decimal places precision).
altitude signedint Y Y 20 Altitude in meters above sea level, if present in metadata options.

5.2.2.9. paramAlertON (MIN 101)¶

Sent automatically when an alert condition has been triggered and is outside normal operating range.

paramAlertON¶
Field Name Type Optional Fixed Size Comments
paramId unsignedint N Y 8 Parameter for which the alert has been raised.
value

dynamic

  • unsignedint
  • signedint
  • string
  • data
 N N/A N/A

Value of the triggering parameter with data type corresponding to the parameter encoding:

  • uint8, uint16 use unsignedInt
  • int8, int16, int32 use signedInt
  • float32, string, base64string use string
  • raw uses data
timestamp unsignedint Y Y 31

Alert timestamp, seconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z.

Only present if configured in metadata options.
parameters array Y N 100 A set of parameter values defined by the alert configuration.
  • paramId
 unsignedint N N/A 8 The paramId being reported.
  • value

dynamic

  • unsignedint
  • signedint
  • string
  • data
 N N/A N/A

Value with data type corresponding to the parameter encoding:

  • uint8, uint16 use unsignedInt
  • int8, int16, int32 use signedInt
  • float32, string, base64string use string
  • raw uses data
  • paramTimestamp
 unsignedint Y N/A 31

Parameter timestamp in seconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z.

Only present if paramTimestamp is configured in metadata options.
paramTimestamp unsignedint Y Y 31

Alert parameter timestamp, seconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z.

Only present if paramTimestamp configured in metadata options.
latitude signedint Y Y 24

Latitude in milliminutes, if present in metadata options.

Divide by 60000 to get decimal degrees (round to 6 decimal places precision).
longitude signedint Y Y 25

Longitude in milliminutes, if present in metadata options.

Divide by 60000 to get decimal degrees (round to 6 decimal places precision).
altitude signedint Y Y 20 Altitude in meters above sea level, if present in metadata options.

5.2.2.11. paramAlertChange (MIN 103)¶

Sent automatically when an alert condition has changed from the last reported value.

paramAlertChange¶
Field Name Type Optional Fixed Size Comments
paramId unsignedint N Y 8 Parameter for which the alert has been raised.
value

dynamic

  • unsignedint
  • signedint
  • string
  • data
 N N/A N/A

Value of the triggering parameter with data type corresponding to the parameter encoding:

  • uint8, uint16 use unsignedInt
  • int8, int16, int32 use signedInt
  • float32, string, base64string use string
  • raw uses data
changeValue

dynamic

  • unsignedint
  • signedint
  • string
  • data
 N N/A N/A

Relative change from prior value of the triggering parameter with data type corresponding to the parameter encoding:

  • uint8, uint16 use unsignedInt
  • int8, int16, int32 use signedInt
  • float32, string, base64string use string
  • raw uses data
timestamp unsignedint Y Y 31

5.2.2.12. positionChangeAlert (MIN 104)¶

Sent automatically when movement has been detected and geolocation alerts are configured.

positionChangeAlert¶
Field Name Type Optional Fixed Size Comments
latitude signedint N Y 24

Latitude in milliminutes, if present in metadata options.

Divide by 60000 to get decimal degrees (round to 6 decimal places precision).
longitude signedint N Y 25

Longitude in milliminutes, if present in metadata options.

Divide by 60000 to get decimal degrees (round to 6 decimal places precision).
altitude signedint N Y 20 Altitude in meters above sea level, if present in metadata options.
speed unsignedint N Y 8 Speed of travel in km/h.
distance unsignedint N Y 31 Distance moved in tenths of meters, from previous location.
timestamp unsignedint Y Y 31

Alert timestamp, seconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z.

Only present if configured in metadata options.

5.2.2.13. error (MIN 200)¶

Sent automatically when a Modbus communication or configuration problem is detected.

error¶
Field Name Type Optional Fixed Size Comments
err unsignedint N Y 8
Error code.
0 - OK / Device communication recovered
1 - Device communication lost
2 - ReportingId not found in configuration
3 - AlertId not found in configuration
errText string N N 100 Verbose error text corresponding to the error code.
timestamp unsignedint Y Y 31

Error timestamp, seconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z.

Only present if configured in metadata options.
